Package: gov.noaa.messageapi.interfaces

[Java] Interface IRequest

  • A Request is the primary method of communicating process streams or batches in MessageAPI. Requests are derived directly from Sessions, which serve as templates for Requests. Requests themselves hold sets of Records, along with a copy of the Schema, Container, and Protocol used in Request construction. Requests also contain a singular Request-wide Request Record, which hold request wide conditions. Using the setCondition method on an IRequest will set the value of the referenced condition in the request record. Requests should be executed using the submit() method. The submit() method in the DefaultRequest immediately returns a new Response object, executes asynchronously, and eventually resolves in the response. Requests may be reused by updating their record sets and again calling submit(). This manner of use will maintain any state in the request. Creating new requests from a session will create entirely new request state.

    Authors:
    Ryan Berkheimer

        java.util.List<IRecord>  records

    • Methods Summary

        Methods 
        Type Params Return Type Name and description

        Creates and returns a new record for the request.

        Returns the Container held by the Request.

        Creates and returns a deep copy of the request.
        IRequest getCopy(java.util.List<java.lang.String> copyComponents)
        Creates an returns a copy of the request, while only copying the parts of a request specified by name keyword in the argument list.

        Returns the Protocol held by the request.

    • Property Detail

      • java.util.List<IRecord> records

    • Method Detail

      • public IRecord createRecord()

        Creates and returns a new record for the request. The record structure is outlayed entirely outside of code, in the session manifest.

      • public IContainer getContainer()

        Returns the Container held by the Request.

      • public IRequest getCopy()

        Creates and returns a deep copy of the request. All parts of the request are copied (e.g., protocol, schema, container, record defs).

      • public IRequest getCopy(java.util.List<java.lang.String> copyComponents)

        Creates an returns a copy of the request, while only copying the parts of a request specified by name keyword in the argument list. Which specific deep-copy elements are available should be checked against the implementing Request class.

      • public IProtocol getProtocol()

        Returns the Protocol held by the request.

      • public java.util.List<IRecord> getRecords()

        Returns the Records currently held by the request.

      • public IRecord getRequestRecord()

        Returns the request-wide record held by the request. This record is used by request-wide conditions.

      • public ISchema getSchema()

        Returns the Schema held by the request.

      • public java.lang.String getType()

        Returns the type of the request as a string. This is useful for tracking metadata or in-code inspection of implementing class type. The type of request is usually set as a static variable in the implementing class.

      • public void setCondition(java.lang.String id, java.lang.Object value)

        Sets a condition value for the specified condition on the request-record.

      • public void setRecords(java.util.List<IRecord> records)

        Sets the records on the request to the provided list of records. (Does not append, just replaces).

      • public IResponse submit()

        Submits the request for processing, immediately returning a response.
